actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend section 6 (d) (1) of the Military Selective Service Act (50 U.S.C. App. 456 (b) (1) to provide greater training flexibility for Reserve officers ordered to active duty for training for not more than 6 months by deleting the requirement that they be ordered to active duty for not less than 3 months.

summary.text: Provides that Reserve officers ordered to active duty for training for mot more than six months under the Military Selective Service Act may be ordered to such active duty for a period of less than three months. (Amends 50 U.S.C. App. 456 (d)(c))

titles.title: A bill to amend section 6 (d) (1) of the Military Selective Service Act (50 U.S.C. App. 456 (b) (1) to provide greater training flexibility for Reserve officers ordered to active duty for training for not more than 6 months by deleting the requirement that they be ordered to active duty for not less than 3 months.
